Package Contents

Back

 

Unless otherwise specified, the VLIB package installs under C:\ti\ in directory vlib_c674x_3_3_0_3. The files that comprise the VLIB installation can be categorized into the following seven categories.

  1. Documentation
  2. Component Repository
  3. Kernel Directories
  4. Library Directory
  5. Eclipse Support
  6. Internal Meta Data

The sections that follow provide details for each category.

 

Documentation

Installation places all VLIB documentation in a Docs directory in the VLIB root. The following documentation comes with the delivery:

  • VLIB_Users_Manual.html (this document)
  • Release Notes
  • Software Manifest
  • Cycle Benchmarks

 

Component Repository

The installation creates a Components directory in the VLIB root folder. This directory serves as a repository for all packages included in the VLIB installation. Each package in this repository is compressed.

 

Kernel Directories

The installation also creates a Packages directory in the VLIB root folder. This directory holds all kernels contained within the VLIB library. This directory follows the standard TI directory structure. As an example, the files that comprise the VLIB kernel VLIB_dilate_bin_square will be located, relative to the VLIB root installation directory, at packages/ti/vlib/src/VLIB_dilate_bin_square/.

Each Kernel is delivered with a pre-compiled CCS project that illustrates the kernel API and performs several validation tests. Each project provides an estimate of kernel cycle and program memory requirements.

Follow Individual Kernel Build Procedure for building & testing kernel projects.

 

Library Directory

The installation also creates a lib directory in the packages/ti/vlib folder. This directory holds:
  • vlib.lib : Main optimized vlib library
  • vlib_cn.lib : C Natural Implementation of vlib library
  • common.lib : Common functions required for testing kernels.

Eclipse Support

The Eclipse directory contains all files required for VLIB to be recognized by Eclipse (CCS) as a plug-in. This is a support directory and can be safely ignored.

 

Internal Meta Data

The VLIB installation creates a Package directory. This directory contains meta information required by the TI packaging tools. This is a support directory and can be safely ignored.
